titleStmt.title: E. C. Spiceland et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10587

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Execelency B. Magoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

The undersigned would respectfully beg of you to pardon W. M. Williams out of the Penitentiary he was lately sent up from Marshall County charged with Forgery, we would represent to your honour that he has a wife and three small children who were entirely dependent upon his labour for support the children are only from one to five years old the mother is sickly and unable to labour for the support of her children, The County authorities talk of binding with the children, which so distresses the mother that Humanity would propt us to ask for the release of the Father
May 1st 1861.

E. C. Spiceland
R. T. Guier
R L Son
T S Son
A C CAttass
R E James
Jessee Bell
John Martin
P. W. Gardner
R. P. Samford
Wm F. Hamilton
